description: Semantic knowledge base for Ableton Live audio effects - vocal processing focus

EQ Eight.description: 8-band parametric EQ with flexible filter types. Primary tool for frequency sculpting and tonal shaping.
EQ Eight.production_notes: For vocals: Start with high-pass around 80-100Hz to remove rumble. Cut mud around 200-400Hz with narrow Q. Boost presence at 2-5kHz for clarity. Add air at 10-12kHz with a shelf. Use subtractive EQ before additive.

Compressor.description: Versatile dynamics processor with multiple modes. Controls dynamic range and adds punch/sustain.

Attack.description: Time for compression to engage after threshold is crossed

Release.description: Time for compression to disengage after signal drops below threshold

Output Gain.description: Makeup gain to compensate for compression

Dry/Wet.description: Mix between dry and compressed signal (parallel compression)

Compressor.production_notes: For vocals: Start with 4:1 ratio, threshold catching peaks by 3-6dB. Medium attack (10-30ms) to preserve articulation. Medium release (100-200ms) for natural sound. Use makeup gain to match input level. Consider parallel compression at 50% wet for density without losing dynamics.

Glue Compressor.description: SSL-style bus compressor. Adds glue and cohesion to grouped signals. Great for vocal buses.

Range.description: Maximum compression range (limits maximum gain reduction)

Glue Compressor.production_notes: For vocal bus: Use 4:1 ratio, attack 10-30ms, auto release. Aim for 2-4dB gain reduction on peaks. Great for gluing layered vocals together. For master, use lighter settings with 2:1 and 1-2dB reduction.

Saturator.description: Waveshaping distortion/saturation. Adds warmth, harmonics, and analog character.

Type.description: Saturation curve type (0=Analog Clip, 1=Soft Sine, 2=Medium Curve, 3=Hard Curve, 4=Sinoid Fold, 5=Digital Clip)

Dry/Wet.description: Mix between dry and saturated signal

Saturator.production_notes: For vocals: Use Analog Clip or Soft Sine for warmth. Start with 5-10dB drive and reduce wet to 50-70% for parallel saturation. Great for adding presence without harsh EQ. Use after compression to even out the saturation.

Reverb.description: Algorithmic reverb for creating space and depth. Essential for vocal ambiance.

Input Hi Cut.description: High frequency cut on input (darker reverb)

Input Lo Cut.description: Low frequency cut on input (cleaner reverb)

Dry/Wet.description: Mix between dry and wet signal

Reverb.production_notes: For vocals: Use predelay (30-60ms) to keep vocal upfront. Cut lows from reverb input (200-400Hz) to prevent mud. Cut highs for warmer sound or keep for brightness. 1.5-2.5s decay for pop, shorter for hip-hop, longer for ballads. Use send/return for more control.

Delay.description: Digital delay effect. Creates echoes and rhythmic patterns.

Feedback.description: Amount of delayed signal fed back (more repeats)

Dry/Wet.description: Mix between dry and delayed signal

Delay.production_notes: For vocals: Use slapback (50-100ms) for thickening without obvious echo. Quarter note delay for rhythmic interest. Roll off highs (3-5kHz) to sit delay behind vocal. Use tempo sync for groove. Less feedback for clarity, more for ambient effects.

Multiband Dynamics.description: 3-band dynamics processor. Use as multiband compressor or de-esser.

Low-Mid Crossover.description: Crossover frequency between low and mid bands

Mid-High Crossover.description: Crossover frequency between mid and high bands

Multiband Dynamics.production_notes: For de-essing: Set mid-high crossover to 4-6kHz to target sibilance. Use high band compression with fast attack and 4-8:1 ratio. For multiband compression: Use moderate ratios (2-4:1) per band. Great for taming problematic frequencies without affecting entire signal.

CLA-76.description: Waves CLA-76 FET compressor modeled after the 1176 hardware. Fast attack, punchy character. Signature of Chris Lord-Alge's vocal sound.

Input.description: Input gain — drives signal into the compressor. Higher values = more compression.

Attack.description: Attack time (1=slowest/20ms, 7=fastest/0.02ms). Note: reversed numbering — higher = faster.

Ratio.description: Compression ratio (4, 8, 12, 20, or All — all buttons in for limiting)

Revision.description: Hardware revision model (Rev A = bluesripe, Rev E = blackface)

CLA-76.production_notes: Classic vocal compressor. For punchy vocals: Input around 20-30, 8:1 or 12:1, attack 3-5, release 5. Rev A for brighter, Rev E for warmer. The 'All buttons' (Brit mode) trick gives a unique distorted compression. Great for parallel compression — crank input, mix at 30-50%.

punchy_vocal.description: Punchy, upfront vocal — Chris Lord-Alge style

CLA-2A.description: Waves CLA-2A optical compressor modeled after the LA-2A hardware. Smooth, musical compression with simple controls. Iconic for vocals.

Peak Reduction.description: Amount of gain reduction (compression amount). Higher = more compression.

Mode.description: Compression mode — Compress (smooth, program-dependent) or Limit (faster, more aggressive)

CLA-2A.production_notes: The LA-2A is the go-to vocal compressor for smooth, musical compression. The optical circuit responds slowly, making it inherently gentle. Use Compress mode for vocals (Limit for bass or drums). Peak Reduction 35-55 for standard vocals. Simple controls — just dial Peak Reduction until you see 3-7dB of gain reduction. Often paired after a CLA-76 for serial compression.

SSL E-Channel.description: Waves SSL E-Channel strip modeled after the SSL 4000 E-series console. Combines EQ, dynamics (compressor + gate/expander), and filters in one channel strip.

LF Gain.description: Low frequency EQ gain (bell or shelf)

LF Bell.description: Low frequency EQ shape: shelf (off) or bell (on)

HF Gain.description: High frequency EQ gain (bell or shelf)

HF Bell.description: High frequency EQ shape: shelf (off) or bell (on)

Comp Attack.description: Compressor attack time — Fast or Slow (SSL-style switched attack)

Comp Release.description: Compressor release time (100ms to 4s, or Auto)

Filters to Dyn SC.description: Route HP/LP filters to dynamics sidechain

Dyn to Ch Out.description: Dynamics section position: pre-EQ (off) or post-EQ (on)

SSL E-Channel.production_notes: The SSL E-Channel is a complete vocal chain in one plugin. For vocals: HP at 80-100Hz, cut mud with LMF at 300-500Hz, boost presence with HMF at 2-4kHz, add air with HF shelf at 8-12kHz. Compressor with 3-4:1 ratio, slow attack to preserve articulation. Use 'Filters to Dyn SC' to prevent bass from triggering the compressor.

SSL G-Master Buss Compressor.description: Waves SSL G-Master Buss Compressor modeled after the SSL 4000 G bus compressor. The industry-standard mix bus and vocal bus glue compressor.

Makeup.description: Makeup gain to compensate for compression

SSL G-Master Buss Compressor.production_notes: The SSL G-Master Buss Compressor is the go-to for mix bus glue. For mix bus: 4:1, 10ms attack, auto release, threshold for 2-3dB reduction. For vocal bus: 2:1, 3-10ms attack, 0.3-0.6s release, threshold for 1-3dB reduction. Keep it subtle — this is for cohesion, not heavy compression.

H-Reverb.description: Waves H-Reverb hybrid reverb combining algorithmic and convolution reverb technologies. Rich, musical reverb with advanced tail control.

Damping.description: High-frequency damping — higher values darken the reverb tail

ER/Tail Mix.description: Balance between early reflections and late reverb tail

vocal.description: Remove low-end from reverb for clarity

Dry/Wet.description: Mix between dry and reverb signal

Build-Up.description: Reverse build-up time (only active when Reverse is on)

H-Reverb.production_notes: H-Reverb is a premium vocal reverb. For pop vocals: plate preset, 1.5-2s decay, predelay 30-50ms, lo cut at 200-300Hz to prevent mud. For R&B/hip-hop: shorter decay (0.8-1.5s), heavier damping. For ambient/indie: long decay (4-8s), moderate density, lo cut at 150Hz. The ER/Tail mix lets you dial in room character vs. ambiance.

cut_mud.description: Remove muddy low-mid frequencies that cloud vocals

add_presence.description: Add clarity and forward presence to vocals

add_air.description: Add brightness and airiness to vocals

add_warmth.description: Add analog warmth and harmonic richness

control_dynamics.description: Even out volume variations in vocal performance

aggressive_compression.description: Heavy compression for upfront, in-your-face vocals

add_space.description: Add reverb ambiance and spatial depth

de_ess.description: Control harsh sibilance (S and T sounds)

glue.description: Add cohesion to grouped or layered vocals
